utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, I tracked down Marcel and get this, he's healthy, he's happy, and he's right here in New York filming Outbreak II - The Virus Takes Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You're kidding.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: This is amazing.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I finally get a part on TV and the monkey's makin' movies.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, Rachel, I'm ready.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: KID
utterance.content: Excuse me. Is this where the singing lady is that tells the truth?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, yeah I guess that's me.

utterance.speaker: KID
utterance.content: She's here.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Sometimes men love women,

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: This is so exciting, I haven't seen my monkey in almost a year.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What, you never look down in the shower? Oh please. I'm not allowed to make one joke in the monkey-is-penis genre?

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: C'mon people, back up please, back up, c'mon, c'mon, c'mon, c'mon.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me, uh, where can we find the monkey?

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: I'm sorry guys, closed set.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, I'm sorry, you don't understand, I'm, I'm, I'm a friend of his. We uh, we used to live together.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Yeah, and I have a time share in the Pocanos with Flipper.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ross, there he is.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, hey buddy, Marcel. Marcel. In the jungle, the mighty jungle the lion sleeps tonight. In the jungle, the mighty jungle the lion sleeps tonight. a-weema-way, a-weema-way.....

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me folks this is a uhh...

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Closed set. We know but we're friends with the monkey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Good morning. Hey pal, look who I brought. It's your old friend Harry Elefante.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Woah, dude, burn.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I don't get it, he seemed so happy to see me yesterday.

utterance.speaker: TRAINER
utterance.content: Hey don't take it personal, he's under a lot of pressure, ya know, starring in a movie and all.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Now just how big of a star is Marcel?

utterance.speaker: TRAINER
utterance.content: In human terms, I'd say Cybill Shepard.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Woah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, are you guys in the movie, or are you just really paranoid.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me. Jerry is the director, which one's he?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Gotcha. Phoebs, walk with me.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK. Um, how come I'm walking with you?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, we're, we're just goin' over here so that we can get away from the horrible flesh eating virus, for the love of God woman, listen to me. Is he lookin', is he lookin'?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: We've got a problem.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: I can't do Chris's makeup. She refuses to acknowledge that she has a moustasche.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: It looks like one of her eyebrows fell down. Now unless someone convinces her to let me bleach it, Jean-Claude Van Damme is gonna be making out with Gabe Kaplan.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: I hate actors.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Nice camoflauge man, for a minute there I almost didn't see ya.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ahhhh.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Uh, is your name Chandler?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Uh, yes, yes it is.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Chandler Bing?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Do you know me or are you just really good at this game?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: I'm Susie Moss. Fourth grade, glasses, I used to carry around a box of animal crackers like a purse.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Susie Moss, right, yeah, wow, you look. . . great job growing up.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: It's nice to see you're not still wearing that denim cap with all the little mirrors on it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, right, well yeah, I graduated fourth grade and realized I wasn't a pimp.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Remember the class play? You, you pulled up my skirt and the entire auditorium saw my underpants.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes, back then I, uh, used humor as a defense mechanism. Thank God I don't do that anymore.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What what what what?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Jean-Claude Van Damme. I didn't know he was in this movie, he is so hot.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ya think?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: The muscles from Brussels, wham bam Van Damme, did you see Time Cop?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, was he any good in it?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Rachel, he like, totally changed time.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wow, so why don't you go talk to him?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What, so you go over there, you tell him you think he's cute, what's the worst that could happen?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: He could hear me.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, I'm doin' it for ya.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh Rachel don't, don't you dare, don't, don't. Tell him I cook.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Excuse me. Hi.

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Um, this is gonna sound kinda goofy but uhhm, my friend over there, who cooks by the way, um, she thinks you're cute.

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: You don't think I'm cute?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I, I don't know, um, do you think you're cute? OK, we're kinda gettin' off the track here. Um, I was supposed to come here and tell you my friend thinks you're cute. So what should I tell her?

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: You can tell her I think her friend is cute.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, Stephen Hurs was the kid who would eat anything for money, David Stein was the guy who had no elbows.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: OK, well then who was the kid that got caught masturbating?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK that's not what he was doing. Alright, he was looking for his bus money.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Oh that's me, I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh uh, o, OK.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Um, so listen, how many times am I gonna have to touch you on the arm before you ask me on a date.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, uh, let's try one more. . . there you go, say Ernie's, 8 o'clock.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: I'll be there, and who knows, if things go well, maybe this time I'll get to see your underwear.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No one was around to hear that?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So what'd he say?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Agh, what a jerk. I kept talking about you and he kept asking me out. I mean, naturally, you know, I said no.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, thanks anyway.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: He just kept asking, and asking, and asking, and asking, and asking, and asking.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Rachel if you, if you want to go out with him, you can. Sound like a big jerk to me but if that's what you want to do...

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Jean-Claude she said yes, I'll see you tonight. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: And then Jean-Claude took me to that place Crossroads and that's where we hung out with Drew Barrymore.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh man, she's so smokin, she has got the greatest set of. . . no guys around, huh.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Does anybody need anything?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, I'll have an espresso. Oh acutally, I'll get it. If I ask you to, you'll probably end up drinking it yourself.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: That is so unfair.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know. Oh, like you would drink her coffee after what you did to her with Van Damme.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey Joey I have to cancel racketball for tonight, that was Marcel's trainer. He's gonna let me have him for a couple of hours.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You're blowin' me off for a monkey?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, we can rescedule for Saturday.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, unless you hook up with a bunch of pigeons.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, stick a fork in me, I am done.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Stick a fork what?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Like, when you're cooking a steak.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, OK, I don't eat meat.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well then, how do you know when vegetables are done?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well you know, you juist, you eat them and you can tell.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK, then, eat me, I'm done.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I've met the perfect woman. OK, we're sitting on her couch, we're fooling around, and then suddenly she turns to me and says, 'Do you ever want to do it in an elevator?'

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What did you say?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ahh, I believe my exact words were, 'Flaign,en - sten'. I mean I didn't know what to say, how do you know if you wanna do it on an elevator?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, you just know.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Oh, shoot, we gotta go, got a reservation in 30 minutes.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh no no no no, no no no no no no, you see, what I had planned shouldn't take more that 2, 3 minutes tops.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Oh, 200 seconds of passion. We gotta go.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: But um, here's an idea, have you ever worn women's underwear?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, ye, yes, actually, but, uh, they were my Aunt Edna's, and there were three of us in there.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Well I was thinking it would be um, kind of sexy if you wore mine tonight, at dinner.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You want me to wear your panties?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Could ya?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, if I was wearing your underwear then, uh, what would you be wearing?. . . You're swell.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: OK, got the music, got the dinner. Oh and check it out, I made Marcel's favorite dish, banannacake.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oooh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: With mealworms.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yaaahhh. Ahhh, candles. What'dya thinks gonna happen here tonight?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hello. Oh hi, are you on your way ove-. Oh. No, no, I, I understand, I mean a monkey's gotta work. No it, it's no big deal, it' not like I uh, had anything special planned. Yeah OK, OK. OK, OK, bye.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, Rachel, why don't you start talking first.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Alright, I feel that this is totally unjustified. She gave me the green light, I did nothing but-. Do you think I can't see you in the TV set?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright Monica, if there is something that you would like to share...

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ya know, you had no right to go out with him.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: That is the most ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You sold me out.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I did not sell you out.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes you did. Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Would you let me talk.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Did you just flick me?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, well, you wouldn't let me finish and I was jus- Ow. That hurt

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Quit flicking

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ow, you stop flicking.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You flicked me first.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, now I'm gonna kick some ass.

utterance.speaker: MONICA AND RACHEL
utterance.content: Ow. Ow. Ow.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright, now I will let go if you both stop.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, what do you, you want me to stop seeing him, is that what you want?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You want me to just call him up and tell him that you're seeing him instead? That's what you want?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh that's what you want.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Fine,

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: There we go.You know what, if we were in prison, you guys would be, like, my bitches.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Thanks for letting me tag along tonight you guys.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Forget about it.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: How you doin there squirmy?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'm hangin in. . . and a little out.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So, assistant to the director. That's a really exciting job, I mean, you must have a ton of cool responsibilities.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: So what're you guys gonna eat?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: How come all I can think about is putting that ice in my mouth and licking you all over?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Because I went to an all boys high school and God is making up for it.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: I want you right here, right now.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Right now, right here. Don't ya think we're in kind of a public plaaaa They do have the shrimp.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Meet me in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'm going to the bathroom now.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: C'mon.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I can't believe we're doing this.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Alright mister, let's see those panties.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alrighty.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Ooh. Ooh. But ya know what would be even sexier?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: If you didn't have your shirt tucked into them.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Alright. Now I would like to see you wearing nothing but them. Take your clothes off.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK, but uh, I hope you realize this means we're gonna miss hearing about the specials.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: C'mon hurry, hurry.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, do you want this done quick, or do you want this done right?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Alright, turn around. Time to see you from behind.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Oh, somebody's been doing his buns of steel video.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, you want me to uh, clench anything, or-... Susie? Susie.

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: This is for the fourth grade.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Huh? Where, whaddya mean?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Whaddo I mean. Whaddya mean, whaddo I mean? I mean underpants, mister, that's what I mean.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What, what's what you mean?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: My skirt, you lifted, kids laughing. I was Susie Underpants 'till I was 18.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That was in the fourth grade. How could you still be upset about that?

utterance.speaker: SUSIE
utterance.content: Well um, why don't you call me in 20 years and tell me if you're still upset about this.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, I hope you realize you're not getting these underpants back.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I can't believe this, just like 2 weeks ago I was watching Sudden Death, now I'm on a date with Jean-Claude Van Damme. Can you beat up that guy? Can you beat up that guy?

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: This is so wild. Ya know, I gotta admit, I was kinda surprised that you agreed to go on a blind date.

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: Normally, I would not do it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, what made you make the exception for me?

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: 'Cause Rachel told me uh, you were dying to have a threesome with me and uh, Drew Barrymore. By the way, Drew has some groundrules and...

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Say you're sorry.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Say it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Rachel, you say you're sorry or your sweater gets it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, OK, that is my favorite sweater, that is my third date sweater.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Say you're sorry.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, you wanna play? OK, let's play, let's play.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What're you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You give me back my sweater or it's handbag marinara.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You don't have the guts.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Well, at least I wasn't too chicken to tell some guy I thought he was cute.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh alright, stop, STOP THE MADNESS. This is crazy. Who can even remember why this even started in the first place?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yes that's right. But still, I-, look at your purse, look at your sweater, look at yourselves.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'll help you fix your sweater.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I'll help you throw out your purse.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm sorry that I made you stop seeing him.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, I'm sorry I went out with him when I knew you liked him.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm sorry that I borrowed your gloves

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Joey?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ma?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Chandler? What're you still doin' here, I though you guys took off.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, no no no, she took off with my clothes.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Are you naked in there?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Not exactly. . . I'm wearin panties.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Huh, you uh, you always wear panties?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, no, this is the first time.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Wow, talk about your bad luck, I mean, the first time you try panties and someone walks off with your clothes.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I was not trying them out, Susie asked me to wear them.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, let me see.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No. I'm not letting you or anybody else see, ever.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Alright, alright. Woah, someone's flossing.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Joey, some people don't like that.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Chandler's wearing panties.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What? Let me see.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, no, you don't have to see.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi Tushie.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, one of you give me your underpants.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Can't help you, I'm not wearing any.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: How can you not be wearing any underwear?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, I'm gettin' heat from the guy in the hot pink thong.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright look Ross I'll give you 50 dollars for your underpants.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey Phoebs, can I have the milk after you?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm almost done with it, keep your panties on.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, and I'm in the movie.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: One of the virus victims called in sick, so Cathy recommended me and boom, I'm dying on the gurney. Oh Ross, Marcel just finished his last scene if you want to go down there and say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ahh, oh that's OK, I mean, he's probably got, you know, parties to go to and stuff. But, ya know, he's moved on. Hey, that, that's the way it goes right.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: I'm sorry it didn't work out between you and me, or you and me. Drew was very disappointed.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, well, bye.

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, bye for me too.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: OK, well, bye-bye again.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: Perhaps, uh, the three of us, just could. . .

utterance.speaker: MONICA AND RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, no no no no no.

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: Are you sure, I can crush a walnut with my butt.

utterance.speaker: MONICA AND RACHEL
utterance.content: No no no no.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Impressive.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: But no. Maybe if I were baking.

utterance.speaker: MONICA AND RACHEL
utterance.content: Bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Bye Marcel. See ya on the big screen. You keep people drinkin' that beer, OK. I miss you buddy.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You know, I think I want to write a song about all this.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah. Oh, except one of the strings on my guitar is broken. Hey, Chandler, can I borrow your G-string?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: How long you been waitin' to say that?

utterance.speaker: VAN DAMME
utterance.content: Can't you see what's going on here, this man is dying.
